intro: Thibaudia affinis, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Thibaudia affinis thrives in moist, well-drained environments and is often found in grasslands and woodlands.
